title: Twitter Accuses Microsoft of Improperly Using Its Data
description: In a letter to Microsoft’s chief executive, Satya Nadella, Twitter said the tech giant had violated a data agreement.

title: Extremism Finds Fertile Ground in Chat Rooms for Gamers
description: In the past year, about half the people who played online multiplayer games in the world’s major gaming markets encountered extremist statements, a new study found.

title: TikTok and Free Speech Groups Appear Poised for Legal Fight Over Montana Ban
description: Under the law, TikTok would be fined for operating the app, and Google and Apple would be fined for allowing people to download TikTok through their app stores.

title: Elizabeth Holmes Must Report to Prison on May 30
description: The Theranos founder, who was convicted last year of defrauding investors, lost her bid to remain free on bail while she appeals her conviction.

title: OpenAI Introduces ChatGPT App for the iPhone
description: OpenAI is aiming to build on the popularity of its chatbot with a smartphone app that responds to voice prompts.

title: Extremism Finds Fertile Ground in Chat Rooms for Gamers
description: In the past year, about half the people who played online multiplayer games in the world’s major gaming markets encountered extremist statements, a new study found.

title: Supreme Court Sidesteps Ruling on Scope of Internet Liability Shield
description: The justices effectively ducked difficult questions about the scope of a 1996 law, Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act.

title: Meta Made Its AI Tech Open-Source. Rivals Say It’s a Risky Decision.
description: The tech giant has publicly released its latest A.I. technology so people can build their own chatbots. Rivals like Google say that approach can be dangerous.

title: Another Side of the AI Boom: Detecting What AI Makes
description: More than a dozen companies have popped up to offer services aimed at identifying whether photos, text and videos are made by humans or machines.

title: Montana Governor Bans TikTok in the State
description: The legislation is the most extreme prohibition of the app in the nation and will almost certainly face legal challenges.
